product_name: NeutrogenaHydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Water Cream - Fragrance Free
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackReplenish vital water content within skin's surface for more resilient, glowing skin with this water cream. Neutrogena Hydro Boost Water Cream, Fragrance Free is formulated with hyaluronic acid to provide 72 hours of hydration.
details: DetailsBenefitsFace cream replenishes vital water content within skin's surface for more resilient, glowing skinFace moisturizer is ideal for providing weightless hydration to dry, sensitive, & acne-prone skinFacial cream leaves skin feeling plump and glowing in 2 weeks & more resilient in 4 weeksKey IngredientsLightweight face moisturizer contains hyaluronic acid, a dermatologist-recommended hydratorWater cream with Natural Moisturizing Factors is clinically proven to provide hydration for 72 hoursFormulated WithoutFragranceDyesParabensPhthalatesItem 2615560How To UseApply evenly to face and neck daily after cleansing.Precautions: For external use only. Keep out of reach of children.IngredientsWater, Glycerin, Isopropyl Palmitate, Cetyl Alcohol, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, C10-30 Cholesterol/Lanosterol Esters, Ceramide NP, Stearic Acid, Palmitic Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate, Serine, Glycine, Alanine, Threonine, Arginine, Proline, Lysine HCl, Glutamic Acid, Sodium PCA, PCA, Sodium Lactate, Urea, Sodium Chloride, Citric Acid, Betaine, Allantoin, Fructose, Maltose, Trehalose, Glucose, Pentylene Glycol, Dimethicone, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Ethylhexylglycerin, Caprylyl Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Tropolone, Sodium Hydroxide.
how_to_use: Apply evenly to face and neck daily after cleansing.Precautions: For external use only. Keep out of reach of children.

reviews.headline: Sensitive Skin Stay Clear
reviews.comments: My skin broke out in a rash, it was so disappointing. Maybe some will like it, not me. Thankfully got my money back.

reviews.headline: Definitely I would buy this again and I'm actually planning
reviews.comments: I really loved it. It's very smooth on the skin, and my skin absorbs it well, keeping my face hydrated and looking healthy. I love that! The only downside is that the bottle is a bit small, so if they offered a larger size, I would definitely consider buying that. Other than that, I absolutely love it, and it's really affordable!

reviews.headline: Great lightweight hydration
reviews.comments: This is a good product for lightweight hydration. I love the gel-cream texture, how it absorbs into the skin, and how it isn't greasy. Most of the time, this was an effective product, however I felt that on very cold days when my skin was incredibly dry, I needed something else as well. I would purchase the full-size, however it is a little expensive.

reviews.headline: Break outs!
reviews.comments: This made me break out! I'm glad I figured out it's this! Had to throw mine away.

reviews.headline: Lightweight
reviews.comments: This was a good moisturizer and felt lightweight on the skin. Felt very similar to the Tula Dew Your Thing moisturizer. I never woke up with any breakouts when I used this at night. However, I don't know if this would be suitable for somone with acne as I feel like it does just sit on the skin.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: So many people like this product but i dont know why. I put it on and it feels nice at first but then within the hour I'm dry again and its like i didnt put any moisturizer on at all. I tested this out for 2 weeks and my face feels rough, its like this ruined the texture. So weird.

reviews.headline: changed formula
reviews.comments: why would u guys change something so good it makes no sense at all, never buying again the new formula is not nearly as good

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: I love the moisturizer so much i bought the larger size

reviews.headline: Thin consistency but great results
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is great!

reviews.headline: Best for dry skin
reviews.comments: I been using Neutrogena products almost 20 years and always coming back for it for moisture.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and again
reviews.comments: I have a super dry skin as well as eczema and this is the first moisturizer that is so mild without causing any issue as well as keeping my skin fresh and vibrant throughout the day! Thanks for a great product.

reviews.headline: Hydroboost water cream made me break out.
reviews.comments: The water cream made me break out. The gel works much better for me. I will go back to that formulation.

reviews.headline: Neutrogena Hydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Water Cream
reviews.comments: I like this cream it goes on smoothly.

reviews.headline: After a few weeks
reviews.comments: The results I've noticed after 3 weeks of using this are truly amazing. My skin has never been this soft or smooth. I've also noticed the darkness under my eyes has drastically changed, which I was not expecting. This should be a staple in everyone's skin care routine especially in the winter months!

reviews.headline: Very greasy
reviews.comments: Tried this product because it was half the price of the one I usually use ( Peter Thomas Roth) This left a very greasy film on my face.

reviews.headline: Why was the formula changed
reviews.comments: I had used what I now can call the old formula, and did like how my skin felt. I was recommended by my esti to try another brand, but it was just too expensive to continue so I decided to go back to the Neutrogena. Sadly, the formula has been changed, and it is not at all what I experienced previously. I am not experiencing the redness and irritation that others are reporting, but my skin is not moisturized and looks dry and lifeless. My search for a new product begins.

reviews.headline: bring back the old formula
reviews.comments: Horrible. This new formula is simply horrible. It dries out my skin, makes it irritated, and leaves a weird greasy film. It pills like crazy and makes my skin horrible. I miss the old formula! It was perfect and always made my skin feel plump and soft. I swtiched to a higher end brand which is working now how this old neutrogena formula used to. Im incredibly disappointed in neutrogena and this product.

reviews.headline: Burning
reviews.comments:
I used this product once and my skin immediately turned bright red and started burning/ felt hot. I washed my face immediately but the redness and irritation lingered. I came to the reviews to see if other people shared this problem and I was shocked to read so many people had the same reaction.

I also wonder if this product formulation is incorrect and needs to be recalled if this many people are reacting poorly.

reviews.headline: Irritating
reviews.comments: I have sensitive and dry skin. The old formula was really soothing and hydrating. Now whenever I use it my face begins to burn and turn red. I do not think I have seen so much irritation in my face and neck ever.

reviews.headline: Not like the old formula!
reviews.comments: I have worn the hydroboost creme (not water gel) for years. This new formula feels more oily than the old and I have to almost scoop it out and use more than the old formula. It doesn't have the same texture and smoothness. It just isn't the same. Also, much smaller container for same or more cost. So disappointed in this new formula. Really hope they will bring back the gel creme.

faceoff_positive.comments: As someone with dry and sensitive skin, I have struggled to find a product that effectively hydrates without causing irritation. However, the Hydro Boost Water Cream has proven to be a breath of fresh air. I was immediately captivated by its innovative gel-like texture. Unlike heavier creams, this water-based formula feels weightless on the skin, almost as if applying a burst of refreshing spring water. The cream is quickly absorbed, imparting a boost of invigoration and leaving no greasy residue behind. Hydration is king when it comes to moisturizers, and the Hydro Boost Water Cream delivers in spades. Infused with hyaluronic acid, this powerful ingredient acts as a moisture magnet, attracting and retaining water molecules to plump and deeply hydrate the skin. I noticed a visible improvement in my skin's overall moisture levels after just a few days of regular use. Fragrance-free and non-comedogenic, it gently nourishes without clogging pores or causing irritations.I Highly recommend!
faceoff_positive.headline: An Oasis for Your Skin

faceoff_negative.comments:
Please Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture Facial Moisturizer. I've tried the Hydro Boost Products: Hyaluronic SPF 50 Moisturizer, the Water Gel, Water Cream even another brand, Glossmetics, but NOTHING is as good as the old, discontinued SPF 15 Oil-Free Moisture Facial Moisturizer Lotion. Why would you discontinue a wonderful product? If sales were down, then you should have began a new aggressive Marketing Plan focusing on the tried and true product which was around for at least 30 years! If you want to market the Hydro-Boost line, at least give us the choice of using what we want. Here is why the discontinued product is better:

It gives a much better finishSmooth, soothing, and you can use a little for a dewey glow, or a little more for a beautiful, SMOOTH vibrant glossy shine. Plus, any SPF over 15 or 30 is redundant. 15 is all you need. 50 is just over-kill, and makes the Hydro-boost product feel like thick sunscreen. The discontinued product was 4 ounces compared to the measly 1.7 ounces for the Hydro-Boost products.Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture! It wasn't broken, so why did you try to fix something that wasn't broken?
faceoff_negative.headline: Please Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture

rollup.name: Hydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Water Cream - Fragrance Free
